title: Lore wise; Who is the worst fighter/combatant in League of Legends?

replies.body: Bard, he punches like a beach ball. But watch out for those meeps. They're dynamite!

>Lore Wise

His lore literally ends with the line "When the unknowable structure of the universe is threatened, Bard steers all existence away from utter annihilation."

Please stop derailing threads. As much as this is isn't a super-serious thread, as I scrolled down through the interesting posts within this thread only to come across this weak attempt at humor, I was, frankly, appalled. Both by your ignorance of what the thread was asking, as well as your ignorance of your own company's lore.

Even in a non-serious thread, Riot's response is superficial at best.

Dude, he's just joking around like a normal person on their free time. 

Remove the stick.
Yeah, but the thread itself is fun. He's not even saying it ironically as though Bard's Lore would make him the strongest person in the LoL Universe. It's cringe-worthy.
The only thing cringe worthy is your reaction

I doubt that bard is really the strongest.
It was once said by a rioter that bard often prevents catastrophes before they escalate.

For example the magic egg would have been probably a terrible weapon in the wrong hands,but bard simply took it before it could be used by someone like that.

Not to mention that there is always {{champion:203}}

I think Bard is the strongest, even stronger than kindred. Kindred is more of a force of nature. Also, kindred can be "defeated" since there are immortal or un-dead champs. Kindred is omnipresent and omniscient, but it is not omnipotent. I also remember I think Ant in Oz saying that Kindred has an "end" suggesting that it can for a lack of better words "dIe". 

As for the strongest character (champ and non-champ), Nagakeboros might be the strongest character, but we still don't know enough about it.

Even the undead will end one day and it is quite likely that even the immortal champs can be killed.

And I dunno about Kindreds end,but they themselves say that all will die eventually and I remember that someone at least confirmed that Bard can die.

Though I agree that a god like nagakeborous is most likely still stronger than them and they have quite some limitations.

Oh yeah, and another thing that leads me to believe Bard is stronger than kindred is that from what we've read so far Kindred is a spirit native and seemingly bound to Runeterra, whereas Bard can travel between realms and dimensions.

You know,this actually brings up an interesting question:
Do other realms have other spirits of death?I mean if you die in the void,will you be killed by a different spirit?Or will you merely cease to exist?Or won't you die at all and instead live on in another form?

My bets are that the worst fighter is: {{champion:53}} ... Lorewise... i mean, sure he is more powerfull than many champs, but Viktor did not built him as a fighter... Viktor programmed him in order to "assist with Zaun's hazardous waste reclamation process". He is not a war machine... and his lore mentions that he has a "heart of gold", a "person" like him would not harm anyone for real.

And if we consider the "Three Laws of Robotics":

_A robot may not injure a human being or, through inaction, allow a human being to come to harm.
A robot must obey the orders given it by human beings except where such orders would conflict with the First Law.
A robot must protect its own existence as long as such protection does not conflict with the First or Second Laws_

He would not harm a human, ever.

Kindred, they're basically imagination. They can't kill directly, they let others do it and at the victim's moment of death, they appear and taunt the dying target with arrows and fangs. They don't do anything - yes, they might be Death but still... they don't have a physical form.

But also you could blow up the whole planet and kill (nearly) everyone on it ({{champion:34}} and a couple others would survive) and zil would still be there.
So..you can't beat him in a fight, because (lore wise) he's always got his ulti on him. He'd just keep shifting back in time and never die. You'd eventually die of exhaustion, old age, or self injury trying to hurt him..so..he'd be like fighting a brick wall with your bare fists. The wall won't win, but you'd eventually lose.
